questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'open()' function in Python?

options.c: To read or write to a file

questions.question: What is the file mode 'r+' used for?
How do you close a file in Python?

options.c: Automatically closed when the script ends

questions.question: What is the difference between 'read()' and 'readline()' methods?

options.a: read() reads the entire file, readline() reads a single line
options.b: read() reads a single line, readline() reads the entire file

questions.question: How do you write to a file in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'with open() as f:' syntax?

options.a: To open a file in read-only mode
options.b: To automatically close the file after use
options.c: To write to a file in append mode

questions.question: What is the file mode 'w+' used for?

options.c: Read and write mode, overwriting existing content
options.d: Read and write mode, appending to existing content

questions.question: How do you check if a file exists in Python?

options.a: Using the 'isfile()' function from the 'os' module
options.b: Using the 'exists()' function from the 'os.path' module
options.c: Using the 'open()' function and catching exceptions

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'seek()' method?

options.a: To move the file pointer to a specific position
options.b: To read a specific number of bytes from a file
options.c: To write to a specific position in a file

questions.question: What is the file mode 'a+' used for?

options.c: Read and write mode, overwriting existing content
options.d: Read and write mode, appending to existing content

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'tell()' method?

options.a: To move the file pointer to a specific position
options.b: To read a specific number of bytes from a file
options.c: To get the current position of the file pointer

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'os.remove()' function?
What is the purpose of the 'os.rename()' function?
What is the purpose of the 'os.path.exists()' function?

options.a: To check if a file or directory exists

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'os.path.isdir()' function?

options.a: To check if a path is a file
options.b: To check if a path is a directory

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'os.mkdir()' function?
What is the purpose of the 'os.rmdir()' function?
What is the purpose of the 'os.listdir()' function?

options.a: To list all files and directories in a directory

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'os.walk()' function?

options.a: To recursively traverse a directory tree

questions.question: What happens if you try to open a non-existing file in 'r' mode?

options.c: It opens the file in write mode

questions.question: What does the 'wb' mode do?

options.a: Opens a file for writing in binary mode
options.b: Opens a file for writing in text mode
options.c: Opens a file for reading in binary mode
options.d: Opens a file for reading and writing

questions.question: What does the 'try...except' block do?
What is the purpose of 'finally' in try...except...finally?

options.b: To execute code after try, regardless of errors
options.c: To execute code only if no error occurs

questions.question: How do you create a custom exception?
What does 'as' do in an 'except' block?

options.a: Assigns the exception to a variable
